intro: Saxifraga oregana var. montanensis, commonly known as the mountain saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its harsh environment. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and appear in clusters during the summer months. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions and is a valued plant in native plant gardens.
